channel.title: HTTP in Node :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: Node was written primarily to provide tools to develop web servers. So it should come as no surprise that it supports HTTP through a built-in library, the http module. This module provides support for creating both web servers and web clients, as well as working with http requests and responses. Letâ€™s start by examining the latter. Node HTTP Request Remember that a HTTP request is nothing more than a stream of text formatted according to the HTTP standards, as we discussed in Chapter 2.
